intro: Hedyotis acuminata f. scherffiana, commonly known as the Scherff's Indian bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. The plant has slender, ascending stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
